moves.1. e4: In this game black makes an early error and loses quickly.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c3 d5 4. exd5 exd5: ? This is a serious miscalculation, black can't hold this pawn formation.
! Of course. Black loses the pawn since if BxB Qa4+
moves.10... Bd7: ? Still, the exchange instead of this retreat would prolong the game, since now the LSB is strong and bears down on f7.
moves.11... Be6: ?! If ...Nh6, BxN wins, but this does not work either.
moves.13... Ke7: ? The fatal blunder, but Black did not want to lose the R after ....g6, Nxg6! and if ...Nf6, Qb5+. Now White forces mate in 3...
moves.16. Qf3#: A pretty checkmate, where Black's K is trapped in the very center.
